meanings.definition: A type of Polish pastry, typically filled with fruit or cream.
meanings.sent1: I bought a delicious paczki from the bakery.
meanings.sent2: During Fat Tuesday, people enjoy eating paczki.
meanings.sent3: The paczki looked so tasty that I couldn't resist trying one.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as sweet as a paczki.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked paczki filled the room.

meanings.definition: The plural form of 'paczek', a Polish word meaning 'package'.
meanings.sent1: The postman delivered several paczki to our house.
meanings.sent2: I received two paczki in the mail today.
meanings.sent3: The paczki on the doorstep made me wonder what was inside.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with colorful paczki, each holding a surprise.
meanings.sent5: The paczki piled up in the corner, waiting to be opened.
